reviews.title: The worst
reviews.text: There wasn't a soft drink box, no TV, no laundry and the Internet was expensive because it was really slow, if you could get on around the employees. The owner was not friendly at all and his staff like-wise and none were ever helpful. Personal food seemed to disapear from the ice-box. It was a long way from most activities, beaches etc.

reviews.title: surf memorabilia, but HIGH traffic NOISE
reviews.text: The price for a private room was $38, but all the rooms get traffic noise from the downtown corner location. No private bath. Atmosphere is comfortable and the location is good. I got a private bath and a better room at the Wild Ginger Inn, only a couple blocks away, for $40 per night (I stayed 30 nights). Elaine Munro, Berkeley, CA

reviews.title: Hilo Bay Hostel
reviews.text: I'm from Sacramento, CA where a lot of new houses are. Hilo MAY be seen as a run down town, but I think it's cute! The big island is TINY compared to CA, but I loved it! It's very country-ish, and that was awesome.The Hilo Bay Hostel is a newer hostel and freshly renovated. I really liked the look of the rooms, the cleanliness. The showers were public, but very nice and very clean.Great place! Would highly recommend it! Only saw one cockroach, which is pretty amazing for Hilo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would have been good IF the room was not infested with roaches or some beetle . Bathroom looked like it really needed to be fumigated !!! The roaches were coming out from the sink and shower !!! and insects crawling on the ceiling.

reviews.title: Classy and a great deal!

likes.disliked: — Well, it's a hostel, so there are random people close around you.

reviews.title: true aloha spirit
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one night at the Hilo Baby Hostel, and we were very impressed. It's a great deal, and the place was spotless. We had a private room, it was $50, and it had two double beds. The floors were hardwood, and very clean. Because we had a private room, we checked in around 4 p.m. and they gave us a key to the gate so we could come back whenever we wanted.

reviews.title: Fabulous Experience
reviews.text: It looked like there were several vacant rooms and beds, and the place was quiet. There were 4 or 5 computers for using the internet, which we did not use.

This was our first stay in a hostel and we truely loved it! Meeting a variety of people from all over the world when preparing meals in the huge shared kitchen and dining area really made our stay a delight. The old building was seeping with charm- 1920's, high celilings, woodwork and grand staiway. The beds were comfortable, but ask for earplugs as the street is noisy. The staff were friendly and unobtrusive, they immediately responded to any requests. We had a private room- this is a bargain if you are not traveling alone. We liked the location and easily walked to the Farmers Market- a don't miss on Wednesdays and Saturdays. The Tsunami Museum is just down the street and is inexpensive and interesting. I recommend this hostel for all ages. I am 48 and my mother 75. Other guests ranged in age from 20's to 70's and everyone seemed to fit. The staff also arranged for an elderly Hawaiian woman who played a ukele and sang beautifully. I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff, Socializing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights whilst visiting the Big Island. We had a private room which was great, very clean place, very good friendly service. Brilliant kitchen!
reviews.title: Nice little spot

reviews.text: We stayed on a saturday night which was quite noisey but a set of ear plugs worked a treat! Highl;y recommend this spot!
reviews.title: Not Bad......

reviews.text: this was my second time staying at a hostel, and i had a wonderful time. I chose a private room that had two beds. the staff was very helpful and suggested places to see while in hilo. this old building had plenty of character and was very clean ! i met people from all over the world during my 3 days there. i would do it again....
reviews.title: No problems here. Decent hostel.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilo Bay Hostel while traveling solo on the Big Island. It was my first time staying in a hostel in a shared dorm room. I had no problems at all. The staff was friendly and the sheets and bed were clean. I was impressed to find that the showers were actually quite good. The toilets were a bit cramped though. Location in town is great. The only downer is that the dsl was super slow while I was there, and I could not really surf the net. I recommend staying here if you don't mind shared living spaces.
reviews.title: Clean, Functional Hostel In Downtown Hilo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having spent a very plesant 3 nights in Kona, which according to the Lonely Planet is tacky & has no character, we were excited about going to Hilo which it promised to be full of character & like the real Hawaii. For once, I really don't agree with the LP. Hilo is a v odd place, it feels slightly run down, there are no decent restaurants (unless you like heart-attack-inducing junk food, in which case Ken's House of pancakes is the place for you) & I didn't feel that comfortable as a tourist. Maybe it is like the real Hawaii, but personally, I much preferred Kona as at least it's geared towards tourists.
reviews.title: Would NOT stay here again. Couldn't sleep at all....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, as for the hostel itself, it is basic & there's no mistaking that it's a hostel & not something more glamerous. We stayed in the only 1 ensuite room, which was ok, but unbelievably hot. The high ceiling & the fan did nothing to help & having the windows open all night was a bit noisy. The shower didn't get that hot but the room is spacious & has character.
